main_definition: A district or division of a city, typically with its own local government, often derived from historical territorial divisions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Urban administrative division within a city
meanings_and_examples.example: The boroughs in New York City are Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, The Bronx, and Staten Island.
London is made up of several boroughs, each with its own history dating back to medieval times.
The city council and mayor are elected by the residents of Boston's 28 municipal boroughs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A smaller version or part of a larger administrative area
meanings_and_examples.example: District X is considered as one of the boroughs within the greater city Y.
